data.title: May 23 - 29: THIS WEEK IN...
data.meta_description: ... 1995, BODYCOUNT guitarist Ernie C is revealed as the producer of BLACK SABBATH's new record, Forbidden. Ice-T makes a guest appearance on the first cut 'The Illusion Of Power'.... 1996, to coincide with the band's new punk covers opus, Undisputed Attitude, SLAYER hook up with Sub Pop and release...
data.text:
... 1995, BODYCOUNT guitarist Ernie C is revealed as the producer of BLACK SABBATH's new record, Forbidden. Ice-T makes a guest appearance on the first cut 'The Illusion Of Power'.

... 1996, to coincide with the band's new punk covers opus, Undisputed Attitude, SLAYER hook up with Sub Pop and release a 7" of their version of TSOL's 'Abolish Government'.

... 1996, former JUDAS PRIEST/FIGHT screamer Rob Halford unveiled his new project, imaginatively-titled HALFORD - it turns into the dreaded TWO.

... 1996, OZZY OSBOURNE lineup now contains former SUICIDAL TENDENCIES bassist Robert Trujillo and FAITH NO MORE drummer Mike Bordin.

... 1996, TORQUE is a new band featuring ex-VIO-LENCE members.

... 1996, ENTOMBED sign to EastWest in Europe.

... 1996, RUSH give their stamp of approval to Magna Carta's tribute, Working Man.

... 1996, METALLICA gives the OK for an HBO documentray called Paradise Lost (examining a series of violent murders allegedly committed by a gang of heavy metal-loving Arkansas teens) to use their music.

... 1997, BLACKSTAR, featuring ex-members of CARCASS record their debut.

... 1997, "Crazy Larry" the drummer for MALEVOLENT CREATION dies in a fire trying to save his dog.

... 1997, MOTLEY CRUE bassist Nikki Sixx reveals that his solo project is called 1958

... 1997, MOGG-WAY is formed featuring UFO vocalist Phil Mogg and bassist Pete Way, along with drummer Aynsley Dunbar and guitarist George Bellas.

... 1997, ARMAGEDDON featuring the Amott brothers, guitarists Christopher and Michael, release

Crossing The Rubicon

... 1997, MEGADETH release the 'Trust' single

... 1998, MÅ0â0TLEY CRÅ0â5E drummer Tommy Lee stood before Mailbu Judge Laurence J. Mira for sentencing after pleading "no contest" for felony assault charges in May. Lee faces six months jail time, must serve three years probation, refrain from drugs and alcohol during that period, perform 200 hours of community service, and donate $5000 to a battered women's shelter. He also has to stay at least 100-yards away from estranged wife Pamela Anderson. According to Associated Press, he was warned by the judge that if he violates any of the provisions, he'll be sent to a State penitentiary for the full three-year term. Lee is led from the courtroom in handcuffs.

... 1998, guitarist Jon Levasseur rejoins CRYPTOPSY.

... 1998, AC/DC are among the artists honored in a new series of Australian stamps designed to honor Aussie rock greats of the 50s, 60s, and 70s - their 1975 classic 'It's A Long Way To The Top' (If You Wanna Rock N' Roll) provided the inspiration for one of the new designs.

... 1998, drummer Simon Wright rejoins DIO.

... 1998, BLACK SABBATH drummer Bill Ward remains in a London hospital after suffering a mild heart attack during rehearsals for Sabbath's European tour.

... 1998, HELMET officially break up.

... 1998, UNION cancels their first US tour due to lack of tour support.

... 1998, AMEN recruits drummer Shannon Larkin (ex-WRATHCHILD AMERICA/SOULS AT ZERO/UGLY KID JOE).

... 1998, HUMAN WASTE PROJECT leaves Hollywood Records.

... 1999, drummer Nick Barker (ex-CRADLE OF FILTH/current DIMMU BORGIR) is hired by

BORKNAGAR

... 1999, IRON MAIDEN sign to Portrait Records and it is annonced that Kevin Shirley (DREAM THEATER) will produce their reunion album.

... 1999, HELIX reform to add tracks to their forthcoming B-Sides release.

... 1999, rumours begin about a movie based on Tim 'Ripper' Owens' rise to fame in JUDAS PRIEST, set to star Mark Wahlberg.

... 1999, rumours state that DARK ANGEL have reformed.

... 1999, EVEREVE vocalist Tom Sedotschenko has commits suicide.

... 1999, SUPER TRANS ATLANTIC (featuring Jason Beiler from SAIGON KICK and Pat Badger from EXTREME) sign a deal with Universal.

... 1999, The SCORPIONS sign with Koch Records in the US.

... 1999, ARCH ENEMY's Burning Bridges, sells 22,000 copies within its first week of release, entering the Japanese National Charts at #22.

... 2000, FALCONER ink a deal with Metal Blade.

... 2000, guitarist Dave Hogarth leaves BENUMB.

... 2000, ANGELCORPSE split up, according to the Osmose Records website.

... 2001, AGENT STEEL announce they will abandon their name temporarily until legal matters are resolved. They will now go by the name ORDER OF THE ILLUMINATI.

... 2001, DYING FETUS announce that despite rumors to the contrary, they will continue with a new line-up.

... 2001, IRON MAIDEN receive a special award for International Achievement at The 46th Ivor Novello Awards in London.

... 2001, SKINLAB replace guitarist Scott Seargent with ex-WIRED SHUT axeman Glen Telford.

... 2001, SIXTY WATT SHAMAN announce their new drummer is Minnesota Pete Campbell.

... 2001, Candlelight Records ink a deal with Sweden's CENTINEX.

... 2001, Lost Disciple Records ink a deal with Denmark's COMPOS MENTIS.

... 2001, TOOL's Lateralus debuts at #1 on both the Canadian and American album charts.

... 2001, VICIOUS RUMORS vocalist Brian O'Connor re-joins the band, replacing Morgan Thorn.

... 2001, METALIUM sign with Locomotive Music.

... 2001, the three remaining members of RAGE AGAINST THE MACHINE and ex-SOUNDGARDEN frontman Chris Cornell solidify plans to record a full length album together.

... 2001, guitarist Chris Holmes leaves W.A.S.P. again, and is replaced by TUFF's Darrell Roberts.

... 2001, MEGADETH's The World Needs A Hero album lands at #16 on the Billboard charts selling 61,000 copies in it's first week.

... 2001, OZZY OSBOURNE's appearance in Little Nicky is among the performances nominated in the Best Cameo in a Movie category of the 2001 MTV Movie Awards.

... 2001, Norway's SONS OF ANGELS sign with Z Records.

... 2001, ex-URIAH HEEP keyboardist Ken Hensley announces that the cooperation between him and John Lawton is over.

... 2002, KREATOR announce their forthcoming live CD will be called Live Kreation (Revisioned Glory), a name suggested by Nicola R. Radlovic, the winner of the Name The Album contest.

... 2002, due to the obsessively politically correct manufacturers in Germany, the European version of ROTTEN SOUND's new album, Murderworks, will be released with a censored cover.

... 2002, the DEVIN TOWNSEND Band lineup is completed with Scotty McCargar (drums), Brian Waddell (guitar) and Mike and Dave Young (brothers, on bass and keyboards).

... 2002, Navarre Entertainment Media signs Germany's leading independent label for rock and metal music, SPV. Steamhammer Records, SPV Recordings, Audiopharm, Limb Music Products, Inside Out Music, Napalm Records and Breaker Records among others are under the umbrella of labels included in the deal.

... 2002, METALLICA drummer Lars Ulrich reveals that his Elektra imprint, The Music Company, is no longer.

... 2002, THE HAUNTED make an agreement with Fredman studios in Gothenburg for the recording of their third full length album.

... 2002, SENTENCED's The Cold White Light enters Finland's charts at #1. The album entered the German charts at #45.

... 2003, CEPHALIC CARNAGE complete their forthcoming record, titled Lucid Interval.

... 2002, PRIMAL FEAR are invited to shoot an episode of the series Rock for German Music TV Channel Viva Plus.

... 2002, TED NUGENT releases a hunting-based cook book called Kill It And Grill It.

... 2002, MOTLEY CRUE are sued by former producer Tom Werman, who claims the band owes unpaid royalties from the Shout At The Devil, Theater Of Pain and Girls, Girls, Girls albums. Werman is seeking $400,000 plus court costs.

... 2002, ENSLAVED confirm that R. Kronheim is permanently out of the band.

... 2003, DIO report that former guitarist Craig Goldy will rejoin the band this summer on the road.

... 2003, NASUM bassist Jesper announces he is leaving the band.

... 2003, STRATOVARIUS frontman Timo Kotipelto injures his knee during a game of floorball.

... 2003, ANNIHILATOR leader/guitarist Jeff Waters announces that singer Joe Comeau is out of the band due to a difference of opinion on an issue (not of a musical nature) that just couldn't be resolved mutually.

... 2003, Juliette (female vocals) and Roomy (guitar) part company with WITHOUT FACE.

... 2003, FRAGMENTS OF UNBECOMING ink a deal with Metal Blade.

... 2003, FLOWING TEARS announc that their new vocalist is 21 year-old Helen Vogt. Helen replaces Stefanie Duch®?ne who left the band early this year due to personal reasons.

... 2003, Cruz Del Sur Music inks deals with TWILIGHT and HAMMERS OF MISFORTUNE.

... 2003, WHILE HEAVEN WEPT, FALL OF THE LEAFE and DER GERWELT all ink deals with Rage Of Achilles Records.
